metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14814 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
There is heap-based buffer overflow in Linux kernel, all versions up to,excluding 5.3, in the marvell wifi chip driver in Linux kernel, that allowslocal users to cause a denial of service(system crash) or possibly executearbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14814` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1060.67
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1096.107
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1052.54~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1061.66
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1047.50
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1027.30~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1124.133
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1128-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1128.136
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-166.195').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.67').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1096.107').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.54~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.66').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.50').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.30~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.133').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1128.136').
